sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含为"假设，猜想，推测"之意。
means: assume ：指有很少或完全无根据的武断推测或不合逻辑的推理。
presume ：侧重以过去经验或根据现实的某些感觉把某事认定为是事实。
suppose ：常用词，意义较广泛，指缺乏确切事实，根据一些现象进行的推测，也可指为论证而提出合乎逻辑推理的某种假定，有时仅表示自己的意见。
guess ：常用词，指毫无根据仅凭个人主观臆断或碰运气的猜测。
postulate ：指为证实一个理论的正确性而进行的假设。

sentence.Network_en: Don't assume your baby automatically needs feeding if she's fretful.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要想当然地认为你的宝宝一闹就是要吃奶。

sentence.Network_en: Civilians assume, wrongly, that everything in the military runs smoothly.
sentence.Network_cn: 老百姓以为军队中一切都运转正常,其实不然.

sentence.Network_en: People assume they know me through and through the moment we meet.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们一见到我，就自以为对我了如指掌了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin assumere, from ad- 'towards' + sumere 'take'

encyclopedia.content: 段寻址伪指令，用来设定程序中定义的各段名与段寄存器之间的关系。 这条伪指令的含义是“假设”，他假设某一段寄存器和程序中的某一个用segment.......ends 定义的段相关联。通过assume说明这种关联，在需要的情况下，assume并不是一条非要深入理解的伪指令，以后我们编程时，记着将assume将有特定用途的段和相关的段寄存器相关联起来即可。 比如，在程序中，我们用 codesg segment .......codesg ends 定义了一个名为codesg的段

entry.def: If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.

example.ex: It is a misconception to assume that the two continents are similar...
example.tran: 关于这两块大陆相似的假设是一种误解。

example.ex: If the package is wrapped well, we assume the contents are also wonderful...
example.tran: 如果包装精美，我们就会认为里面装的也是好东西。

entry.tran: 掌管，夺取，取得（权力）；承担（责任）
entry.def: If someone assumes power or responsibility, they take power or responsibility.

example.ex: Mr Cross will assume the role of Chief Executive with a team of four directors...
example.tran: 克劳斯先生将出任首席执行官，手下有4位经理。

example.ex: If there is no president, power will be assumed by the most extremist forces.
example.tran: 如果没有主席，权力就会落入最极端的过激分子手中。

entry.tran: 呈现，具有，显露（某种特质）
entry.def: If something assumes a particular quality, it begins to have that quality.

example.ex: In his dreams, the mountains assumed enormous importance.
example.tran: 在他的梦中，山有着至关重要的作用。

entry.tran: 表现出（某种表情）；装出，做出（某种样子）
entry.def: If you assume a particular expression or way of behaving, you start to look or behave in this way.

example.ex: He contented himself by assuming an air of superiority...
example.tran: 他表现出一副高高在上的样子以获得自我满足。

example.ex: Prue assumed a placatory tone of voice.
example.tran: 普吕以一种安慰人的语气说话。

entry.def: You can use let us assume or let's assume when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.

example.ex: Let us assume those clubs actually win something. Then players will receive large bonuses...
example.tran: 倘若那些俱乐部真的赚了，那么球员就会获得一大笔奖金。

example.ex: Let's assume for a moment that I am a litigant in your court.
example.tran: 暂且假设我是你的诉讼当事人。

means.word_mean: 1. take to be the case or to be true; accept without verification or proof;
2. take on titles, offices, duties, responsibilities;

sentences.sentence: "When will the new President assume office?"

means.word_mean: 3. take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect;

sentences.sentence: "His voice took on a sad tone"
"The gods assume human or animal form in these fables"

means.word_mean: 4. take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person;

sentences.sentence: "She took her seat on the stage"
"We took our seats in the orchestra"
"She took up her position behind the tree"

means.word_mean: 6. seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession;

sentences.sentence: "He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town"
"She seized control of the throne after her husband died"
"She assumed indifference, even though she was seething with anger"

means.word_mean: 8. Christianity, obsolete; take up someone's soul into heaven;

sentences.sentence: "This is the day when May was assumed into heaven"
"He put on his best suit for the wedding"
"The princess donned a long blue dress"

auth_sentence.res_content: Why do we assume there was one Big bang?

auth_sentence.content: Inside the cell they assume some properties of life.

stems_affixes.word_buile: consume使着迷+ing……的→adj.强烈的,分量重的
presume[v.假定,假设,认为,揣测,滥用,擅自行动]+able……的→adj.可假定的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 消耗;吃完,喝光;[with]使着迷;烧毁
stems_affixes.word_buile: con共同+sume拿,取→全拿完→消耗[完],沉迷于

stems_affixes.value_cn: 再继续,重新开始;再用;恢复
stems_affixes.word_buile: re再+sume拿,取→重新拿起→再用;恢复
re再+assume[v.假装;假定,设想;承担;呈现,采取]→v.再假定

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装;假定,设想;承担;呈现,采取
stems_affixes.word_buile: as加强动作+sume拿,取→拿住→认为是……[假定],承担

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假定,假设,认为,揣测,滥用,擅自行动
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先+sume拿,取→预先拿住→假定

Sentence.sentence: In contrast," the researchers continue, "many regulations that don't assume people make rational choices have been successfully applied to control alcohol, a substance — like food — of which immoderate consumption leads to serious health problems.
The biggest problem is that couples assume each other know what's going on with their finances, but they don't.
I am not a mathematician, but I assume the rise from 70p to 90p is a rise of 25 percent.
In schools, teachers and pupils alike often assume that if a concept has been easy to learn, then the lesson has been successful.
People often assume that more money will make them happier

Back in the good old days—say, two years ago, when the last of my children suffered the ordeal (折磨)—a high-school student applying to college could procrastinate all the way to New Year's Day of their senior year, assuming they could withstand the parental pestering (烦扰).

means.word_mean: 假设, 臆断, 猜想

sentences.en: We can't assume anything in this case.
sentences.cn: 在这种情况下我们不可能做出假设。

means.word_mean: 装出，假装，佯作，装作有(或是)

sentences.en: He assumed a look of innocence.
sentences.cn: 他装出一副天真无邪的样子。

means.word_mean: 承担, 担任, 就职

sentences.en: I made a mistake and I will assume responsibility for it.
sentences.cn: 我错了，我愿为此承担责任。

means.word_mean: 呈现，呈(某种形式、面貌等)；具有(…的作用、特征、性质等)；采取

sentences.cn: 我们采取了一种新方法。

jushi.chinese: 这一因素日益显出其重要性。

jushi.english: That is tacitly assumed, though it was not yet formally proved.
jushi.chinese: 这点是得到默认的,尽管未经正式证实。

jushi.english: He assumed command of the Eighth Army.
